question.title: Jackson (de)serialization with redisTemplate
question.body:
A user has roles, and the serialized version that is stored in Redis is:

"{\"@class\":\"package.User\",\"id\":null,\"email\":\"john.doe@example.com\",\"firstName\":\"John\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"password\":\"passwordhash",\"roles\":[\"java.util.HashSet\",[{\"@class\":\"package.Role\",\"id\":1,\"role\":\"ROLE_USER\"}]]}"

Now the problem is getting this value as a deserialized POJO, which results in the following error:

"Could not resolve type id 'java.util.HashSet' as a subtype of `package.Role`: Not a subtype\n at [Source: REDACTED (`StreamReadFeature.INCLUDE_SOURCE_IN_LOCATION` disabled); line: 1, column: 227] (through reference chain: package. User[\"roles\"])"

The user class or entity, in this case, has a relation with the role entity:

    private Set<Role> roles = new HashSet<>();

The Redis template looks like this:

   @Bean
    public GenericJackson2JsonRedisSerializer redisSerializer() {
        ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();
        objectMapper.registerModule(new JavaTimeModule());
        objectMapper.disable(SerializationFeature.WRITE_DATES_AS_TIMESTAMPS);
        objectMapper.activateDefaultTyping(
                LaissezFaireSubTypeValidator.instance,
                ObjectMapper.DefaultTyping.NON_FINAL,
                JsonTypeInfo.As.PROPERTY
        );
        return new GenericJackson2JsonRedisSerializer(objectMapper);
    }

    @Bean
    @Primary
    public RedisTemplate<String, Object> redisReplicaTemplate(GenericJackson2JsonRedisSerializer redisSerializer) {

        RedisTemplate<String, Object> template = new RedisTemplate<>();
        template.setConnectionFactory(lettuceReplicaConnectionFactory);

        template.setKeySerializer(new StringRedisSerializer());
        template.setValueSerializer(redisSerializer);
        template.setHashKeySerializer(new StringRedisSerializer());
        template.setHashValueSerializer(redisSerializer);

        template.afterPropertiesSet();

        return template;
    }

question_comments.body: @ViktoriyaKutsarova I was able to resolve the issue. It was coming from my data model setters and getters; I made a mistake with the naming, which was unintended. I will post some insights into this particular issue soon. Thank you.

Hi Roger, we've tried to reproduce the problem but haven't been able to. Could you please share the Spring Data Redis version and a minimal reproducible example (just a short snippet, no unrelated code) that triggers the same error? Please include the exact data model you're using and any additional Jackson configurations (annotations or config files). Without that info, we can't determine whether this is a bug in your code, a library issue, or something environment-specific.
